key_insight: Yume-1.5 delivers text-controlled, interactive world generation by combining an efficient diffusion-based generator with compact context management and fast sampling, enabling realistic, explorable scenes in near real-time.
problem_solved: Addresses oversized models, long multi-step inference, and unbounded historical context growth in prior interactive world generators, while adding explicit text-conditioned control for generation.
method: Efficient diffusion backbone with fast-sampling/distillation to drastically reduce inference steps and latency.
Compact history encoding (memory compression or recurrent state) to bound context growth and support continuous interactive updates.
Text-conditioning module that maps user instructions to controllable world edits and generation, enabling fine-grained text-driven interaction.
impact: Enables deployable, low-latency text-to-world systems suitable for real-time interactive applications (games, simulations, virtual environments), lowering compute requirements and improving UX for designers and users.
visual_elements: Architecture diagram: text input → conditioning module → efficient diffusion generator → world state, with a compact memory module shown.
Latency vs. prior methods chart: inference steps and end-to-end response time comparison highlighting reduced steps/compute.
Timeline or interaction loop: user text edit → incremental world update → preserve bounded history (memory compression) — illustrating real-time interaction.
Before/after examples: short sequence showing text instruction and resulting world edit (e.g., 'add river' → updated scene).
paper_title: Yume-1.5: A Text-Controlled Interactive World Generation Model
paper_authors: Xiaofeng Mao, Zhen Li, Chuanhao Li, Xiaojie Xu, Kaining Ying
